notes.gpio2: Strapping pin (boot mode influence). Avoid external circuits that force level at reset.
notes.gpio8: Strapping pin. Certain boot/download behaviors depend on it; avoid pulling low at reset.
notes.gpio9: Strapping pin with internal pull-up on many boards; avoid forcing low at reset unless you mean to enter download mode.

notes.usb_serial_jtag: If your board uses native USB Serial/JTAG, prefer not to reassign GPIO18/19.
notes.jtag_default: Often used for JTAG in some configs/boards; you may reuse, but be cautious during debugging.
notes.uart0_default: Often used for UART0 (logs/bootloader). Can be remapped, but keep a safe default for flashing/debug.

capabilities.gpio_matrix_note: Peripherals can be routed through IO MUX/GPIO matrix; PinPilot still chooses safe/recommended pins.

notes: Strapping pins should not be forced to conflicting levels during reset.
If using native USB Serial/JTAG, treat GPIO18/19 as reserved.
Keep UART0 pins available (20/21) in early prototypes to simplify flashing/logging.
